member.name: M:BankSystem7.BankAggregate.BankAccountAggregate.BankAccountRepository.CheckBankAccount(BankSystem7.BankAggregate.BankAccountAggregate.BankAccount)

summary.para: The method checks if the BankAccount object is null and throws an exception if it is.

The next condition checks if the UserID property of the BankAccount object exists in the ID property of any user in the Users table of the database. If it doesn't exist, the method throws a KeyNotFoundException with a message indicating that the entity of the user with the given ID was not found.

The last condition checks if there exists a BankAccount object in the database with the same ID as the one passed to the method. If it doesn't exist, the method throws a KeyNotFoundException with a message indicating that the entity of the bank with the given ID was not found.

member.exception: Entity of user with id {{{item.ID}}} wasn't found. or Entity of bank with id {{{item.ID}}} wasn't found

member.name: M:BankSystem7.BankAggregate.BankAccountAggregate.BankAccountRepository.AnotherBankTransactionOperation(BankSystem7.UserAggregate.User,BankSystem7.UserAggregate.User)

summary.para: The method returns a boolean value. Inside the method, there is a single line of code that checks if the bank associated with the user's card's bank account is different from the bank associated with the user's card's bank account.
If the banks are different, the method returns true. Otherwise, it returns false.

member.param: The parameter represents the user who is transferring the money
The parameter represents the user who is receiving the money
